properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally heavy rain tonight into early Thursday morning. Rain associated with clusters of showers and thunderstorms moving across portions of the area tonight will produce locally heavy rainfall amounts in the 40 to 50 mm range. Ponding on roadways and flooding in low lying areas will be possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-16T20:07:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T05:14:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1008161943.2020
Area: Greater Sudbury and vicinity, Blind River - Thessalon, Espanola - Killarney, Manitoulin Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southerly wind gusts will reach up to 100 kilometres per hour tonight. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-16T11:22:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-15T19:23:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3093625895.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Patchy frost expected overnight tonight. Locations: Low lying inland areas along the west coast from St. George's to Gros Morne and the Great Northern Peninsula. Remarks: Light winds and clear skies will create conditions favourable for the development of frost as temperatures in some areas dip as low as 2 C. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-16T09:59:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T01:06:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0725561851.2020
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Northern Peninsula East, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: near +2 (coolest in low lying areas). Locations: central and western Newfoundland. Time span: early Friday morning. Remarks: Patchy frost is expected to form as clear skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures, especially in low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-16T23:47:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T07:48:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1302836726.2020
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain will continue this evening. Total rainfall: 50 mm. Locations: eastern Avalon. Time span: continuing until overnight tonight. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-16T11:00:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T01:06:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0378074424.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
